page.title: 08GOULCEBY-ASTERBY:DEVELOPMENT
page.content: The twin villages of Goulceby and Asterby,originated as a Viking settlement,the inhabitants were Free- holders under Danish Law,but owed allegiance to the Soke of Belchford. Both are mentioned in the first{Domes- {day}survey,with overlordship being vested in the Norman Barony of Blankney.In the 13th Century this passed to the Manor of Burwell,which has been owned by various of the Nobility,ending with the Lister family in 1883. { The population peaked in 1841 at 600 when most worked in agriculture,and {fell to about 200 in 1983.}The village school was endowed by the Church in 1638,the present building being erected in 1756,rebuilt in 1826 & 1856 and closed in 1957.{St.Peter's church Asterby,founded in the 12th.century, twice rebuilt, was closed in 1983.
